page.title: 16 Transport B5000
page.content: The B5000 runs from Tamworth to Polesworth. It starts as a single and changes to a dual carriageway outside our school. There are not many pavements on the B5000,there are grass verges instead. In the winter the grass gets muddy and people have to walk on the road and that is dangerous as they might get killed. Underpasses on the B5000 are full of graffiti and they smell. There are 4 roundabouts on the B5000. There is an Industrial Estate nearby which makes the road very busy. 380 cars drive past every half hour,also 60 vans,30 lorries,20 motor bikes and 5 bicycles. 280 car drivers were male and 100 female. The most common lorry load was gravel going to help build the nearby M42. The most commn registration letter was 'B'which is this years registration letter.
